title: INVENTORY / MULLEN IDENTITY
description: "Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity". Dick Mullen is mistaken for someone (an identity).

dialogueTree.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "In your hand, you hold four-fifths..."
dialogueTree.text: In your hand, you hold four-fifths of "Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity."

links.title: You: "Examine the cover."
links.text: Examine the cover.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The cover features a pastiche of di..."
links.text: The cover features a pastiche of different scenes. In the foreground, a man in a dark overcoat clutches a pistol to his chest. Rising up behind him are two silhouettes wrapped in a passionate embrace.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The tagline reads: "Detective Dick..."
links.text: The tagline reads: "Detective Dick Mullen must prove his innocence after an old friend is murdered -- by someone who looks just like Dick Mullen!" That seems to sum up the premise nicely.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Needless to say, it violates nearly..."
links.text: Needless to say, it violates nearly every RCM regulation for a detective to investigate a murder in which he is a suspect.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are you really reading that, detec..."
links.text: "Are you really reading that, detective?"

links.title: You: ""I really need to know who this Dic..."
links.text: "I really need to know who this Dick Mullen guy is."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good luck finding it. He's not muc..."
links.text: "Good luck finding it. He's not much of a character, I think you'll find. Just a stand-in for the reader."

links.title: Conceptualization: "The point is for the reader to feel..."
links.text: The point is for the reader to feel like *they're* solving the crime along with Dick Mullen. A crude narrative convention, but no less effective for it.

links.title: You: ""I'm looking for advice on being a..."
links.text: "I'm looking for advice on being a real detective."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, you won't find it in *there*..."
links.text: "Well, you won't find it in *there*. Those books are much more about ravishing dames and gun play than real policework."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "When was the last time *you* ravish..."
links.text: When was the last time *you* ravished a dame, detective? Besides your crusty old sock, that is.

links.title: You: ""I'm just skimming it.""
links.text: "I'm just skimming it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's probably for the best. Thos..."
links.text: "That's probably for the best. Those books aren't exactly famed for their tight plotting."

links.title: Drama: "It's much more about the dark and d..."
links.text: It's much more about the dark and deadly atmossssphere.

links.title: You: "Start reading."
links.text: Start reading.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Why? There's truly no point. You'll..."
links.text: Why? There's truly no point. You'll never know who did it, because those pages have literally been scattered to the wind.

links.title: You: "I just want to relive the experienc..."
links.text: I just want to relive the experience.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "If you insist. But again, it's real..."
links.text: If you insist. But again, it's really pointless...

links.title: You: "You're right. I should just quit. (..."
links.text: You're right. I should just quit. (Close the book.)

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The story opens with a knock at the..."
links.text: The story opens with a knock at the door. Detective Dick Mullen is greeted by an old friend, Charlie Spillane, who's come to Mullen to ask a favour on this dark and cold night...

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Spillane needs Mullen to drive him..."
links.text: Spillane needs Mullen to drive him in from Vesper to a small town along the Insulindian coast. Despite his friend's apparent agitation, Mullen does as he's asked, then returns home where he passes out drunk, as he does most nights...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "An extremely unprofessional and *hu..."
links.text: An extremely unprofessional and *hurtful* stereotype that's offensive to all upstanding officers of the law.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "But also extremely *accurate*, in y..."
links.text: But also extremely *accurate*, in your case.

links.title: You: "Hey, I'm trying at least."
links.text: Hey, I'm trying at least.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Are you, though?"
links.text: Are you, though?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Give it time. You'll fall off the w..."
links.text: Give it time. You'll fall off the wagon sooner or later.

links.title: You: "Look, I can't judge."
links.text: Look, I can't judge.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Two days later, Mullen is arrested..."
links.text: Two days later, Mullen is arrested by the Vesper police and charged with the murder of Charlie Spillane. At his interrogation, Mullen learns that Charlie Spillane was shot in a bar in the very town Mullen dropped him off in, by a man matching *Mullen's* description...

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Desperate to clear his name, Mullen..."
links.text: Desperate to clear his name, Mullen manages to convince the Vesper police to release him for *three days* so that Mullen may solve his friend's murder and prove his innocence.

links.title: You: ""The cops release their prime murde..."
links.text: "The cops release their prime murder suspect so he can find 'the real killer'? Are you shitting me?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What's the matter, detective?" The..."
links.text: "What's the matter, detective?" The lieutenant turns to you with a start.

links.title: You: ""I don't know who's writing this sh..."
links.text: "I don't know who's writing this shit, but I get the feeling they aren't experts on homicide investigations."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant shrugs, resigned to..."
links.text: The lieutenant shrugs, resigned to the idea that his profession will rarely, if ever, be accurately represented in art and literature.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "They're not shitting you, detective..."
links.text: They're not shitting you, detective. This is what the writers think passes for police procedure.

links.title: You: "Okay, so Mullen didn't do it. (Keep..."
links.text: Okay, so Mullen didn't do it. (Keep reading.)

links.title: You: "No way Mullen did it. (Keep reading..."
links.text: No way Mullen did it. (Keep reading.)

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Of *course* Mullen didn't do it. Th..."
links.text: Of *course* Mullen didn't do it. That's the whole premise of the book! Anyway, Mullen returns to the seaside bar where Spillane was murdered, and meets a *beautiful*, *mysterious* woman named Deanna Deneuve.

links.title: You: "Nice, a dame."
links.text: Nice, a dame.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "And not just any dame -- she's trul..."
links.text: And not just any dame -- she's truly one-in-a-million, a knock-out whose *mind* is as dangerous as her *curves*. But she's got a *secret*.

links.title: You: "Man, who doesn't?"
links.text: Man, who doesn't?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Secrets are the currency of human r..."
links.text: Secrets are the currency of human relations.

links.title: Volition: "Your secrets are unknown even unto..."
links.text: Your secrets are unknown even unto you, so does that make you a rich man or a beggar?

links.title: You: "Sounds like my kind of woman."
links.text: Sounds like my kind of woman.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "She's any man's kind of woman, acco..."
links.text: She's any man's kind of woman, according to this book.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Are you s-s-sure about that? Someth..."
links.text: Are you s-s-sure about that? Something about her gives you a *bad* feeling. What kind of *secret* is she hiding?

links.title: Composure: "You couldn't handle a woman like th..."
links.text: You couldn't handle a woman like that. Look at yourself. You couldn't even handle your --

links.title: Inland Empire: "STOP. Don't say it!"
links.text: STOP. Don't say it!

links.title: You: "Don't say what?"
links.text: Don't say what?

links.title: Composure: "Nothing. Forget it. Go back to your..."
links.text: Nothing. Forget it. Go back to your story.

links.title: You: "Now it's getting interesting. (Keep..."
links.text: Now it's getting interesting. (Keep reading.)

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Deneuve reveals that she was Spilla..."
links.text: Deneuve reveals that she was Spillane's lover, and that he was mixed up with a local amphetamine smuggling operation. As soon as Mullen begins pulling at strings, the whole conspiracy begins to unravel...

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Not only is the local police captai..."
links.text: Not only is the local police captain in on the amphetamine ring, so is the son of a powerful politician, and a strung-out art collector named Torvald. Each of whom has his own reasons for wanting Spillane dead...

links.title: You: "Tell me about the corrupt police ca..."
links.text: Tell me about the corrupt police captain.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Outwardly, the old police captain i..."
links.text: Outwardly, the old police captain is a real law-and-order crypto-fascist, a barrel-chested man who's beaten his share of suspects to pulp. But he's also dirty, and increasingly paranoid that someone's going to expose his role in the drug ring...

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "He would certainly have the motive..."
links.text: He would certainly have the motive and the means, but the captain walks with a noticeable *limp* from an old war injury. Is it possible he was able to conceal it long enough to commit the murder?

links.title: You: "I want to hear about the politician..."
links.text: I want to hear about the politician's son.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "A typical privileged twat. In all l..."
links.text: A typical privileged twat. In all likelihood, he's just in over his head. He does bear a personal grudge against Spillane though, a former prosecutor who nearly brought down his father's administration...

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The kid doesn't exactly have Dick M..."
links.text: The kid doesn't exactly have Dick Mullen's manly build, but he is the correct height, and while interrogating him at his home, Mullen *did* notice a certain overcoat that looks suspiciously like his own...

links.title: You: "What was that about an art collecto..."
links.text: What was that about an art collector?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Torvald the Art Collector is a stru..."
links.text: Torvald the Art Collector is a strung-out mess. Frankly, it's hard to imagine him holding a pistol steady enough to actually hit someone, let alone plug them three times in the chest the way old Spillane got did...

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "That said, Torvald and Spillane hav..."
links.text: That said, Torvald and Spillane have a long history, and while interrogating him, Mullen discovers that Torvald was once *involved* with Deanna Deneuve. Could it be that this is all over a sordid *love triangle*?

links.title: You: "Okay, let's get on with the story."
links.text: Okay, let's get on with the story.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "One evening, Deanna Deneuve comes t..."
links.text: One evening, Deanna Deneuve comes to Mullen's hostel room in tears. The two of them drink half a bottle of vodka, and soon they're seeking comfort in each other's arms...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Yes, comfort and pleasure. The warm..."
links.text: Yes, comfort and pleasure. The warmth of another human's touch, the burning taste of liquor on her full, sweet lips...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Well, *that* testimony won't be adm..."
links.text: Well, *that* testimony won't be admissible any longer.

links.title: You: "How does Mullen expect to solve the..."
links.text: How does Mullen expect to solve the murder if he's sleeping with witnesses!

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "The man's a prosecutor's nightmare...."
links.text: The man's a prosecutor's nightmare. Solving a murder counts for nothing if all the evidence gets thrown out in court over police misconduct.

links.title: Authority: "That's just Dick Mullen's *modus op..."
links.text: That's just Dick Mullen's *modus operandi*. He might bend the rules, but he closes cases no one else can.

links.title: You: "Nice. Get it, Mullen."
links.text: Nice. Get it, Mullen.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "As the two lovers share a post-coit..."
links.text: As the two lovers share a post-coital cigarette, Deanna Deneuve turns to Mullen and says, "By the way, Dick, there was something else I meant to tell you..."

links.title: Inland Empire: ""I love you"?"
links.text: "I love you"?

links.title: Half Light: "The name of the true killer?"
links.text: The name of the true killer?

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: ""Always aim for the centre of mass"..."
links.text: "Always aim for the centre of mass"?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Whatever it is, Mullen never hears..."
links.text: Whatever it is, Mullen never hears the words -- A blow to the base of his skull knocks him out cold instantly.

links.title: You: "Fuck."
links.text: Fuck.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "When Mullen comes to, Deneuve is de..."
links.text: When Mullen comes to, Deneuve is dead on the hostel bed next to him. To make matters worse, his clothes are covered with her blood!

links.title: You: "Double fuck!"
links.text: Double fuck!

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Mullen trashes his blood-stained cl..."
links.text: Mullen trashes his blood-stained clothes and flees the hostel, knowing it's only a matter of hours before the cops discover Deneuve's body, if they haven't been tipped off already...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Fleeing a crime scene, destroying e..."
links.text: Fleeing a crime scene, destroying evidence... Even if Detective Mullen *didn't* commit the murder, he should be facing *years* behind bars.

links.title: Authority: "Dick Mullen won't be sent to the cl..."
links.text: Dick Mullen won't be sent to the clink for the sake of some *legal niceties*!

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The heat is on! If Dick Mullen can'..."
links.text: The heat is on! If Dick Mullen can't solve both murders before the cops catch up to him, he's going away for life...

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "And you'll never know what happens!..."
links.text: And you'll never know what happens! Because the rest of the book is gone.

links.title: You: "I can surmise, can't I? If Mullen g..."
links.text: I can surmise, can't I? If Mullen goes to jail there wouldn't be like fifty more of these books.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "What makes you think this isn't *th..."
links.text: What makes you think this isn't *the final Dick Mullen case*?

links.title: You: "Isn't there already a book called "..."
links.text: Isn't there already a book called "Dick Mullen and the Final Case" or something?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "How do you know this isn't the *fin..."
links.text: How do you know this isn't the *final* final case?

links.title: Logic: "This could go on forever. End it no..."
links.text: This could go on forever. End it now.

links.title: You: "Okay, whatever, this is getting rid..."
links.text: Okay, whatever, this is getting ridiculous. (Close the book.)

links.title: You: "Guess that's it, then. (Close the b..."
links.text: Guess that's it, then. (Close the book.)

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Can you solve the case before the c..."
links.text: Can you solve the case before the cops close in?

links.title: You: "Wait -- I've got some questions fir..."
links.text: Wait -- I've got some questions first.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "What is it, detective?"
links.text: What is it, detective?

links.title: You: "Why does everyone close to Dick Mul..."
links.text: Why does everyone close to Dick Mullen wind up dead?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "It's a dangerous line of work, but..."
links.text: It's a dangerous line of work, but somebody has to do it. That's why Dick Mullen never lets anyone get *too* close...

links.title: Half Light: "What's the matter? Afraid you've be..."
links.text: What's the matter? Afraid you've been hacking up your friends' bodies in the night?

links.title: Inland Empire: "You *are* the murderer, after all....."
links.text: You *are* the murderer, after all...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Have you gone over everyone? Is any..."
links.text: Have you gone over everyone? Is anybody missing?

links.title: You: "Why did Dick Mullen become a detect..."
links.text: Why did Dick Mullen become a detective in the first place?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "There was never a time when he wasn..."
links.text: There was never a time when he wasn't a detective. He was born a detective.

links.title: You: "Was I *not* born to be a detective?"
links.text: Was I *not* born to be a detective?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "For a moment, you cease to read the..."
links.text: For a moment, you cease to read the story on the page and see the book for what it is, a collection of brittle, cheaply printed pages, held together by glue made from the hooves of horses...

links.title: Physical Instrument: "From nowhere, you hear the screech..."
links.text: From nowhere, you hear the screech of sneakers on a waxed floor, and you feel the burn of rope against your hands. Are these figments of some other life?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You won't find the answers you're l..."
links.text: You won't find the answers you're looking for here, in other words.

links.title: You: "But why is he like that?"
links.text: But why is he like that?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Dick Mullen was made to crack skull..."
links.text: Dick Mullen was made to crack skulls and solve cases. It's who he is. He could no more stop being a detective than a tiger could cease to be a predator in the night.

links.title: Volition: "You're no tiger, though, Harry. You..."
links.text: You're no tiger, though, Harry. You're a man. It's your curse to have to choose.

links.title: Volition: "You're no tiger, though, detective...."
links.text: You're no tiger, though, detective. You're a man. It's your curse to have to choose.

links.title: You: "Why bother solving crimes when the..."
links.text: Why bother solving crimes when the world is so evil?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Is it really so evil, detective?"
links.text: Is it really so evil, detective?

links.title: You: "Okay, maybe not. There are parts wo..."
links.text: Okay, maybe not. There are parts worth saving.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Like what?"
links.text: Like what?

links.title: You: "Friends and family."
links.text: Friends and family.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Do you even *have* those?"
links.text: Do you even *have* those?

links.title: You: "I've got Kim."
links.text: I've got Kim.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Just make sure you don't lose him...."
links.text: Just make sure you don't lose him. You'll not find another like him...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It's true in more ways than you kno..."
links.text: It's true in more ways than you know.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You haven't been treating the lieut..."
links.text: You haven't been treating the lieutenant much like a friend, though, have you?

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You haven't. But it's not too late...."
links.text: You haven't. But it's not too late. You share a bond that's thicker than blood.

links.title: You: "I might. I just need to find them."
links.text: I might. I just need to find them.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes, yes. They're out there waiting..."
links.text: Yes, yes. They're out there waiting for you, just over the next rise, up on Marvel Hill!

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Did you lose them? Or did they leav..."
links.text: Did you lose them? Or did they leave you? Do you even know the difference?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "But then what does this book know?..."
links.text: But then what does this book know? It's just a poorly made piece of pulp garbage, made to be consumed and discarded.

links.title: You: "I did, but I lost them."
links.text: I did, but I lost them.

links.title: You: "The pleasure of contemplating art!"
links.text: The pleasure of contemplating art!

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You don't know how you know, but yo..."
links.text: You don't know how you know, but you can feel this book *laughing* at you.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "*Art*? You think contemplating *art..."
links.text: *Art*? You think contemplating *art* is going to save you?

links.title: You: "Yeah, I do. I'm the god damn art co..."
links.text: Yeah, I do. I'm the god damn art cop, after all.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Whatever you say, *art cop*. The bo..."
links.text: Whatever you say, *art cop*. The book has stopped laughing, but you can feel it grinning smugly at you.

links.title: You: "Hey, fuck you book! (Give the book..."
links.text: Hey, fuck you book! (Give the book the finger.)

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You know you look like a mad man, r..."
links.text: You know you look like a mad man, right? Giving an inanimate object the finger like that.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What's the matter, detective?""
links.text: "What's the matter, detective?"

links.title: You: ""This book is making fun of my sinc..."
links.text: "This book is making fun of my sincerest beliefs."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then perhaps you should stop readi..."
links.text: "Then perhaps you should stop reading it."

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "But you can't stop, can you? You've..."
links.text: But you can't stop, can you? You've got to find out what happens.

links.title: You: "The sweet taste of a good cigarette..."
links.text: The sweet taste of a good cigarette, which I still need to find.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "There are worse things in the world..."
links.text: There are worse things in the world than the pursuit of chemical pleasures. But there are better things, too...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "What's a *book* know about real ple..."
links.text: What's a *book* know about real pleasure? What's better than feeling your mesolimbic pathway flood your mind-crevices with *pure* dopamine?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Why are you even still reading this..."
links.text: Why are you even still reading this garbage? You've got smokes to find!

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Why are you even still reading this..."
links.text: Why are you even still reading this garbage? Rip some sweet cigs instead!

links.title: You: "The taste of a good cigarette."
links.text: The taste of a good cigarette.

links.title: You: "The smooth taste of some ultra-high..."
links.text: The smooth taste of some ultra-high-proof booze.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "There are worse things in the world..."
links.text: There are worse things in the world than the pursuit of chemical pleasures. But there are better things, too...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "What's a *book* know about real ple..."
links.text: What's a *book* know about real pleasure? What's better than feeling your mesolimbic pathway flood your mind-crevices with *pure* dopamine?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Why are you even still reading this..."
links.text: Why are you even still reading this garbage? Heed the bottle's call.

links.title: You: "Drugs. You know it's all about the..."
links.text: Drugs. You know it's all about the drugs.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "There are worse things in the world..."
links.text: There are worse things in the world than the pursuit of chemical pleasures. But there are better things, too...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "What's a *book* know about real ple..."
links.text: What's a *book* know about real pleasure? What's better than feeling your mesolimbic pathway flood your mind-crevices with *pure* dopamine?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Why are you even still reading this..."
links.text: Why are you even still reading this garbage? Baby, get some of that sweet speed or spooky pyrholidon... it's the good stuff.

links.title: You: "Yep, it's pretty fucking evil."
links.text: Yep, it's pretty fucking evil.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Then why are you still here?"
links.text: Then why are you still here?

links.title: You: "Because I don't want to let Kim dow..."
links.text: Because I don't want to let Kim down.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Just make sure you don't lose him...."
links.text: Just make sure you don't lose him. You'll not find another like him...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It's true in more ways than you kno..."
links.text: It's true in more ways than you know.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You haven't been treating the lieut..."
links.text: You haven't been treating the lieutenant much like a friend, though, have you?

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You haven't. But it's not too late...."
links.text: You haven't. But it's not too late. You share a bond that's thicker than blood.

links.title: You: "Because I need to solve this case...."
links.text: Because I need to solve this case. Not for anyone else's sake. For me.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "What are you trying to prove, exact..."
links.text: What are you trying to prove, exactly? And what will change if you *do* manage to prove it?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "But then what does this book know?..."
links.text: But then what does this book know? It's just a poorly made piece of pulp garbage, made to be consumed and discarded.

links.title: You: "Because I'm too chickenshit to do a..."
links.text: Because I'm too chickenshit to do anything about it.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "It sounds like you're in for a long..."
links.text: It sounds like you're in for a long, hard road, detective...

links.title: You: "I... don't know."
links.text: I... don't know.

links.title: You: "Unfathomably evil. Death is infinit..."
links.text: Unfathomably evil. Death is infinitely preferable to this torment.

links.title: You: "Good, evil, it makes no difference...."
links.text: Good, evil, it makes no difference. These are the end times we're living in.

links.title: You: "I don't have any more questions. I'..."
links.text: I don't have any more questions. I've figured it all out.

links.title: You: "I've figured it out."
links.text: I've figured it out.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "So who did it, detective? Who kille..."
links.text: So who did it, detective? Who killed Charlie Spillane and Deanna Deneuve?

links.title: You: "Communism killed them."
links.text: Communism killed them.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "What? That doesn't even make sense...."
links.text: What? That doesn't even make sense. There's never a straight answer with you, is there? You just get hooked on random stupid notions and then repeat them every chance you get.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Now go on, find out who *really* di..."
links.text: Now go on, find out who *really* did it.

links.title: You: "Love did them in."
links.text: Love did them in.

links.title: You: "The dirty police captain?"
links.text: The dirty police captain?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Could be. Who knows? Only one way t..."
links.text: Could be. Who knows? Only one way to find out.

links.title: You: "Finish the book."
links.text: Finish the book.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You begin furiously flipping throug..."
links.text: You begin furiously flipping through pages. Even as you know these books follow a series of well-worn tropes, you find yourself completely engrossed. You're turning pages so fast you don't even notice the ancient spine coming unglued...

links.title: Reaction Speed: "You try to grab the pages as they c..."
links.text: You try to grab the pages as they come loose but your fingers aren't quick enough... they're gone.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Dozens of pages scatter across the..."
links.text: Dozens of pages scatter across the ground. The last fifth or so of the book seems to have been lost. It's possible that you could gather and reassemble the pages, but it would take way too long.

links.title: You: ""Stupid old horse glue.""
links.text: "Stupid old horse glue."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, yes. The problem with mass mar..."
links.text: "Ah, yes. The problem with mass market paperbacks... They're not made to last..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Perhaps this is a sign that you sh..."
links.text: "Perhaps this is a sign that you should get back to solving your own murder, eh, detective?"

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Yes, blame a dead horse for your fa..."
links.text: Yes, blame a dead horse for your fat, clumsy fingers.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Don't forget, it could have been th..."
links.text: Don't forget, it could have been the *delirium tremens*.

links.title: You: ""Gah! Now I'll never know!""
links.text: "Gah! Now I'll never know!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Too bad, detective. If it's any co..."
links.text: "Too bad, detective. If it's any consolation, the resolution is almost never very satisfying..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And on that note, perhaps we shoul..."
links.text: "And on that note, perhaps we should get back to making sense of our own case?"

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "That's right. You never will. But t..."
links.text: That's right. You never will. But then, isn't that how it is in real life, detective?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Last year, more than 71% of murders..."
links.text: Last year, more than 71% of murders in Revachol went unsolved. In Revachol West, that number was closer to 85%.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Dozens of pages scatter across the..."
links.text: Dozens of pages scatter across the floor. The last fifth or so of the book seems to have been lost. It's possible that you could gather and reassemble the pages, but it would take way too long.

links.title: You: "The junkie art collector?"
links.text: The junkie art collector?

links.title: You: "The politician's twat son?"
links.text: The politician's twat son?

links.title: You: "Uh... Dick Mullen?"
links.text: Uh... Dick Mullen?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Have you been paying attention *at..."
links.text: Have you been paying attention *at all*? It wasn't Mullen! It. Was. An. Imposter. Now go on, find out who *really* did it.

links.title: You: "You know what? I don't even care. (..."
links.text: You know what? I don't even care. (Close the book.)

links.title: You: "Can't trust a dame. (Shake your hea..."
links.text: Can't trust a dame. (Shake your head.)

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Who can you trust in this wicked, m..."
links.text: Who can you trust in this wicked, messed-up world?

links.title: You: "Your partner. (Look at Kim.)"
links.text: Your partner. (Look at Kim.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant gives you a quizzica..."
links.text: The lieutenant gives you a quizzical expression in return. You go back to the story...

links.title: You: "No one. Just your own two eyes."
links.text: No one. Just your own two eyes.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "That's exactly what Dick Mullen say..."
links.text: That's exactly what Dick Mullen says in "The Dame Who Did It."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Unfortunately, *your* eyes might no..."
links.text: Unfortunately, *your* eyes might not be up to the task. Speaking of... should you maybe consider getting corrective lenses? Your nose is like two centimetres from the page.

links.title: You: "No way. I'm no binoclard."
links.text: No way. I'm no binoclard.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Whatever you say, Detective Hyperop..."
links.text: Whatever you say, Detective Hyperopia. Why don't you get back to the story?

links.title: You: "Uh, I'll think about it. Better get..."
links.text: Uh, I'll think about it. Better get on with the story first.

links.title: You: "No one. You gotta go with your gut."
links.text: No one. You gotta go with your gut.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "That's exactly what Dick Mullen say..."
links.text: That's exactly what Dick Mullen says in "Dauntless Dick and the Fatal Appointment."

links.title: Endurance: "Speaking of, *your* gut's seen bett..."
links.text: Speaking of, *your* gut's seen better days. It's a cesspool of burbling acids and noxious fumes, the kind of thing the government might declare a Zone of Irredeemable Catastrophe.

links.title: You: "Why is my gut in such bad shape?"
links.text: Why is my gut in such bad shape?

links.title: Endurance: "Could it be an underlying condition..."
links.text: Could it be an underlying condition aggravated by years of greasy meals scarfed down between shifts? Or the litres upon litres of hard liquor guzzled on an empty stomach?

links.title: Endurance: "No point in worrying about it just..."
links.text: No point in worrying about it just now. Why don't you get back to the story?

links.title: You: "Don't you sass me. Get on with the..."
links.text: Don't you sass me. Get on with the story.

links.title: You: "Your partner. Kim will be there for..."
links.text: Your partner. Kim will be there for me.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Will *you* be there for *him*, thou..."
links.text: Will *you* be there for *him*, though, when push comes to shove? Time will tell. In the meantime, let's get on with the story...

links.title: You: "I don't really like where this is g..."
links.text: I don't really like where this is going. (Close the book.)

links.title: You: "I'm not sure I'm happy with this, b..."
links.text: I'm not sure I'm happy with this, but maybe the story will turn it around.

links.title: You: "I feel like I've read this before...."
links.text: I feel like I've read this before. (Close the book.)

links.title: You: "Keep reading."
links.text: Keep reading.

links.title: You: "I don't need to read this. I'm alre..."
links.text: I don't need to read this. I'm already living it. (Close the book.)

links.title: You: "[Put the book away.]"
links.text: Modus: Mullen.

links.title: You: "[Put the book away.]"
links.text: [Put the book away.]

dialogueTree.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "In your hand, you hold "Dick Mullen..."
dialogueTree.text: In your hand, you hold "Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity." The brittle paperback feels fragile to the touch.
